definition: to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue
old variant of 辭|辞[ci2]
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: Unbidden guests are often welcomest when they are gone.
sentences.chinese: 不速之客往往是在告辞时最受欢迎。

sentences.english: The cow mama immediately and cannily starts leave-taking.
sentences.chinese: 牛嬷嬷立刻机灵地起身告辞。

sentences.english: The Venerable Ananda could only provide such answer and bid Farwell.
sentences.chinese: 尊者阿难只能做这样的回应，就告辞了。

sentences.english: Wang Shutong says good - bye come out , meeting torrential heavy rain.
sentences.chinese: 王树彤告辞出来，正遇上滂沱大雨。

sentences.english: Niangs looking at atmosphere not to, immediately take advantage of an opportunity leave-taking.
sentences.chinese: 十一娘看着气氛不对，立刻趁机告辞。

sentences.english: Lin Tong Lin view, going back to the company to work overtime and leave haidong.
sentences.chinese: 林桐来看林非，海东要回公司加班于是告辞。

sentences.english: I think it’s time for us to leave now.
sentences.chinese: 我想现在是我们告辞的时候了。

sentences.english: Their visit did not continue long after the question and answer above-mentioned;
sentences.chinese: 这一问一答以后，客人们没有隔多久就告辞了。

sentences.english: The Predictor has done her work and left the room.
sentences.chinese: 告辞完成了任务离开了房间。

sentences.english: I think it\'s about time we got going.
sentences.chinese: 我想差不多是该告辞的时候了。

sentences.english: Sam excused himself to see what had happened to Wal-Mart stock.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆想去看看沃尔玛股票的情况，他告辞离开了。

sentences.english: Presently she excused herself and went home.
sentences.chinese: 一会儿，她就托故告辞回家了。

sentences.english: She told me, as I departed, that she'd hate to be in my position.
sentences.chinese: 我告辞时，她对我说，她才不愿处在我的地位。

sentences.english: Cui two Kua sons start leave-taking.
Lord Guan eyed Liu Bei, who sensed his brother's intent and rose to bid Zhou Yu farewell.
sentences.chinese: 关羽给刘备使眼色，刘备会意，起身告辞。

definition: to petition for retirement (old)/to ask for leave to withdraw/to ask to be excused
to say goodbye/leave-taking/farewells
goodbye (modest formula)/Excuse me, I must leave.
to take leave
to take leave
to get up/to leave/to set forth
to cup one's hands in obeisance or greeting/(fig.) submissive
to bow
leave-taking/to say goodbye
to go on a journey/to leave
to report on completion of a mission/debriefing
to salute/to greet
to express thanks
to salute/to make one's salutations
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
